alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Clay; Doddridge; Gilmer; Harrison; Lewis; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 1:11AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Doddridge, Gilmer, Lewis, Braxton, northwestern Upshur, northeastern Clay and southern Harrison Counties through 200 AM EDT... At 111 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Salem to 7 miles northeast of Glenville to near Big Otter. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Weston, Glenville, Sutton, Gassaway, Jackson Mill, Stonewall Jackson, Big Otter, Cedar Creek State Park, West Milford, Burnsville, Lost Creek, Jane Lew, Flatwoods, Sand Fork, Nebo, Shock, Rosedale, Alum Bridge, Ireland and Camden. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 39 and 115. Route 19 near mile marker 68. Route 33 between mile markers 1 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.

area.areaDesc: Braxton; Clay; Doddridge; Gilmer; Harrison; Lewis; Upshur
